questions.hint: This is the most common time signature.
questions.explanation: 4/4 is also called common time and is widely used in various music genres.

questions.questionText: Identify the note on the third space of the treble clef.
questions.hint: The notes on the spaces spell FACE.
questions.explanation: The spaces of the treble clef spell out FACE from bottom to top.

questions.questionText: Listen to the audio and select the correct note.

questions.questionText: Which of the following represents a quarter note?
questions.hint: This note is worth one beat in common time.
questions.explanation: A quarter note is a note that receives one beat in common time (4/4).

questions.questionText: Which of the following notes is NOT in the C major scale?
questions.hint: C major has no sharps or flats.
questions.explanation: The C major scale consists of C, D, E, F, G, A, and B. It does not contain F#.

questions.questionText: What type of chord is this?
questions.hint: This chord sounds bright and happy.
questions.explanation: A major chord consists of a root, major third, and perfect fifth.

questions.questionText: How many beats does a half note get in 4/4 time?
questions.hint: A half note is worth two quarter notes.
questions.explanation: A half note receives two beats in common time (4/4).

questions.questionText: Which scale has F# in it?
questions.explanation: G major has one sharp (F#) in its key signature.

questions.questionText: Which of these chords is a minor chord?
questions.hint: This chord has a minor third.
questions.explanation: A minor chord consists of a root, minor third, and perfect fifth.
